cmdGA

Class NoOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • cmdGA.Option
      • cmdGA.NoOption

  • public class NoOption
extends Option
    Represents an option of a command line that do not accepts any arguments. Its value can be only boolean.
    Author:
    Javier Iserte

    • Method Detail

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String value)
              throws IncorrectParameterTypeException
        Parses that string that represents the arguments and set its value to the option. This Option, do not needs an arguments. If any is found an IncorrectParameterTypeException is thrown. Calling this option, assumes that the return value is true.
        Specified by:
        setValue in class Option
        Parameters:
        value - Is a string that represents the arguments for an option.
        Throws:
        IncorrectParameterTypeException

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue()
        Returns:
        the value of the option
